problems.title: Word Search
problems.description:
Problem Statement

Given an m x n grid of characters and a string word, return true if word exists in the grid.

The word can be constructed from letters of sequentially adjacent cells, where adjacent cells are horizontally or vertically neighboring. The same letter cell may not be used more than once.
problems.examples:
Sample Input
3 4
ABCE
SFCS
ADEE
ABCCED

Sample Output
true

Explanation:
Grid:
A B C E
S F C S
A D E E
Word "ABCCED" exists.

starterCodes.code:
class Solution:
    def exist(self, board, word):

        pass

if __name__ == '__main__':
    import sys
    data = sys.stdin.read().strip().split('\n')
    m, n = map(int, data[0].split())
    board = []
    for i in range(m):
        board.append(list(data[i+1]))
    word = data[m+1]
    sol = Solution()
    print('true' if sol.exist(board, word) else 'false')

hintsList: DFS from each cell. If cell matches word[0], continue to neighbors.
Mark visited cells to avoid reuse in same path.
